nycTheatreExcerpt: "Eureka Day has more in store for us than laughs, though, and the second half of the play, while occasionally funny, becomes absolutely intriguing and even heart-tugging as characters we think we have pegged reveal depths we hadn't expected. As the peacemaking Don is wont to say, there are no villains here, and try as we might to point fingers at a few, it becomes increasingly hard to do so given how expertly and compassionately the playwright written  and the top-notch cast performed  these strugglers-through-life."
